name: Analyze Research Papers and Identify Research Gaps
definition: This capability accepts academic literature in various forms—including natural language texts, references, Arxiv IDs, or attached PDFs—and performs a deep content analysis to produce a comprehensive report. The report includes detailed summaries, key insights, and explicitly identifies unexplored or under-researched areas, offering potential research ideas and directions for further investigation. The output is provided in a structured JSON list or Markdown format.

name: Answer Questions
definition: This capability allows users to engage in natural language conversation and ask questions. It accepts diverse user inputs—including queries, requests for explanations, and discussion topics—and returns clear, helpful, and contextually relevant textual responses that support multi-turn dialogue and detailed explanations.

name: Browse the web
definition: This capability allows users to submit a query (such as a question or search request) to retrieve current web-based information. It accepts a text input representing the query and produces an answer or relevant details derived from browsing up-to-date web content.

name: Download Paper PDFs
definition: This capability accepts a JSON object with an 'arxiv_ids' field containing a list of ArXiv paper IDs. It downloads each paper's PDF file, encodes the content in Base64 format, and returns a JSON list where each element is the Base64 encoded string of the corresponding PDF file.

name: Edit and Transform Text
definition: Performs structured text edits including find-and-replace, templating, and content transformations. Accepts text input along with transformation instructions, and returns the modified text as output.

name: Execute academic signal task
definition: Processes end-to-end academic signal tasks by accepting user instructions that specify a date and a research domain (e.g., artificial intelligence, machine learning, deep learning). This capability collects relevant academic information, interprets the underlying signals, provides recommendations, and generates a comprehensive report that summarizes findings and insights.

name: Extract, Filter, and Recommend Papers
definition: This capability accepts input in the form of either a natural language text or a JSON object containing one or more ArXiv IDs. It automatically extracts valid ArXiv IDs from free text if needed, retrieves complete metadata for each paper, and applies intelligent filtering, sorting, and ranking based on predefined semantic criteria or user instructions. The capability produces a JSON list of recommended paper ArXiv IDs ordered by recommendation priority, with the output limited to a maximum of 8 papers.
alias: Extract, Filter, and Recommend from Text

name: Greeting and Help
definition: This capability handles user greetings and provides information about the agent's functionalities. It accepts text inputs such as greetings or questions about capabilities, and outputs an explanation of available functions, usage instructions, and detailed information on how to effectively use the agent's services.

name: Iterative User Prompt Optimization
definition: This capability refines and iteratively improves a user-supplied prompt to enhance its clarity, precision, and overall effectiveness. It accepts a text input representing the prompt along with feedback details when available, and returns an optimized version that better meets user requirements.

name: Review Academic Paper
definition: This capability reviews an academic paper provided either as a PDF file or via a URL. For PDF files, it accepts an input that includes a file name ending in .pdf and Base64-encoded file bytes. For URLs, it automatically downloads and caches the corresponding PDF. In both cases, the agent extracts the text and metadata from the paper and generates a comprehensive review report. This report includes paper metadata, scores (on a scale from 1 to 10) for methodology, novelty, clarity, and significance, as well as a detailed analysis covering summary, strengths, weaknesses, and questions. The output is returned as a structured text message in markdown format.

name: Search Academic Papers
definition: This capability accepts either natural language instructions or a structured query to search academic papers across various databases, such as ArXiv and Semantic Scholar. It returns a structured list of up to five relevant papers, with each entry including key metadata such as the title, authors, publication year, a truncated abstract, and available links (e.g., URL/PDF).
